in_ports.name: mask
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] Initial mask, consisting of  possible elements GC_BGD=0, GC_FGD=1, GC_PR_BGD=2 or GC_PR_FGD=3.
Usually you need to set some points GC_BGD, some points GC_FGD, and fill all other points with GC_PR_BGD or GC_PR_FGD.
It is used only if "reset" flag is set or if the mode is "GC_INIT_WITH_MASK".

in_ports.name: figure
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Additional figure (binary picture), that is combined with the current mask

out_ports.name: mask
out_ports.hint: Result mask, consisting of  possible elements GC_BGD=0, GC_FGD=1, GC_PR_BGD=2 or GC_PR_FGD=3.

out_ports.name: success
out_ports.hint:
Usually contains "true", excepting the case when "Require non-trivial samples" is false
and the mask does not contain required elements; in the latter case contains "false".

controls.name: reset
controls.description: If set, this function initializes its state. Please clear it to allow this function to accumulate information about processed images.

controls.name: mode
controls.caption: Mode
controls.description:
Note: if "reset" flag is set, this parameter must be "GC_INIT_WITH_RECT" or "GC_INIT_WITH_MASK". In the second  case, you still may omit the input initial mask; in this case, it will be filled automatically according "Initial mask filler" parameter.
Also note: while resetting in the mode "GC_INIT_WITH_MASK", you must specify some initial mask and/or the input figure, that will be drawn over the mask/mask filler; the mask (after adding the figure) should contain at least one GC_BGD/GC_PR_BGD and at least one GC_FGD/GC_PR_FGD element.

controls.name: figureKind
controls.caption: What is "figure"?
controls.description:
If input "figure" is specified, it can be "drawn" on the current mask as the specified value before calling grabCut function.
Note that GC_PR_BGD and GC_PR_FGD cases may be used for ERASING some surely classified samples from already EXISTING mask.

items.caption: Non-zero elements of "figure" are GC_BGD (surely background)
Non-zero elements of "figure" are GC_FGD (surely foreground)
Non-zero elements of "figure" are GC_PR_BGD (possible background)
Non-zero elements of "figure" are GC_PR_FGD (possible foreground)

controls.name: initialMaskFiller
controls.caption: Initial mask filler
controls.description:
If "reset" flag is set, initially created mask is filled by this value. It is usually should be GC_PR_BGD or GC_PR_FGD (that means "you are not sure") â€” GC_BGD or GC_FGD fillers will lead to mask where nothing to do: all is known.
This argument is ignored (not important) if there is the input initial "mask" or if "GC_INIT_WITH_RECT" mode is selected.

controls.name: nonTrivialSamplesRequired
controls.caption: Require non-trivial samples
controls.description: If true, then in "GC_INIT_WITH_MASK" this function requires that the mask (maybe after drawing the "figure") must contain at least one GC_BGD/GC_PR_BGD and at least one GC_FGD/GC_PR_FGD element; in other case, it throws an exception. If false,  exception is not thrown in such situation; instead,  the mask is returned without changes and the result "success" flag will contain false.

controls.name: percents
controls.description:
If true, start X/Y and sizes below are measured in percents of image sizes.
Note: start X/Y and sizes are used only in "GC_INIT_WITH_RECT" mode.

controls.caption: Y-size (height)
controls.name: sizeY
controls.description:
Note: zero x/y-size means all space from start x/y until the right/bottom bound of the image.
Also note: the selected rectangle should be less than the full image.

controls.name: packBits
controls.caption: Pack bits in the result
controls.description:
If set, bits in the resulting masks "mask_bgd", "mask_fgd", "mask_pr_bgd",  "mask_pr_fgd" are packed (binary matrix). If cleared, every element in these matrices will occupy 1 byte and will be equal to 0 (zero bit) or 255 (unit bit).
Note: the main result "mask" is always a byte matrix with possible elements GC_BGD=0, GC_FGD=1, GC_PR_BGD=2 or GC_PR_FGD=3.
